channel.title: CVE Feed for Symantec Corporation -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Symantec Corporation -- all products

item.title: CVE-2018-5238|2024-09-17T00:21:49.834Z -- symantec%20corporation -- norton%20power%20eraser
item.description: Norton Power Eraser (prior to 5.3.0.24) and SymDiag (prior to 2.1.242) may be susceptible to a DLL Preloading vulnerability, which is a type of issue that can occur when an application looks to call a DLL for execution and an attacker provides a malicious DLL to use instead. Depending on how the application is configured, it will generally follow a specific search path to locate the DLL. The vulnerability can be exploited by a simple file write (or potentially an over-write) which results in a foreign DLL running under the context of the application.

item.title: CVE-2017-15525|2024-09-17T01:41:18.504Z -- symantec%20corporation -- symantec%20endpoint%20encryption
item.description: Prior to SEE v11.1.3MP1, Symantec Endpoint Encryption can be susceptible to a denial of service (DoS) attack, which is a type of attack whereby the perpetrator attempts to make a particular machine or network resource unavailable to its intended users by temporarily or indefinitely disrupting services of a specific host within a network.

item.title: CVE-2018-5241|2024-09-17T03:28:24.667Z -- symantec%20corporation -- advanced%20secure%20gateway%20%28asg%29
item.description: Symantec Advanced Secure Gateway (ASG) 6.6 and 6.7, and ProxySG 6.5, 6.6, and 6.7 are susceptible to a SAML authentication bypass vulnerability. The products can be configured with a SAML authentication realm to authenticate network users in intercepted proxy traffic. When parsing SAML responses, ASG and ProxySG incorrectly handle XML nodes with comments. A remote attacker can modify a valid SAML response without invalidating its cryptographic signature. This may allow the attacker to bypass user authentication security controls in ASG and ProxySG. This vulnerability only affects authentication of network users in intercepted traffic. It does not affect administrator user authentication for the ASG and ProxySG management consoles.

item.title: CVE-2017-15527|2024-09-17T03:29:03.354Z -- symantec%20corporation -- symantec%20management%20console
item.description: Prior to ITMS 8.1 RU4, the Symantec Management Console can be susceptible to a directory traversal exploit, which is a type of attack that can occur when there is insufficient security validation / sanitization of user-supplied input file names, such that characters representing "traverse to parent directory" are passed through to the file APIs.

item.title: CVE-2018-5237|2024-09-17T00:30:52.218Z -- symantec%20corporation -- symantec%20endpoint%20protection
item.description: Symantec Endpoint Protection prior to 14 RU1 MP1 or 12.1 RU6 MP10 could be susceptible to a privilege escalation vulnerability, which is a type of issue that allows a user to gain elevated access to resources that are normally protected at lower access levels.

item.title: CVE-2017-13677|2024-09-17T02:16:31.679Z -- symantec%20corporation -- advanced%20secure%20gateway%20%28asg%29
item.description: Denial-of-service (DoS) vulnerability in the Symantec Advanced Secure Gateway (ASG) and ProxySG management consoles. A remote attacker can use crafted HTTP/HTTPS requests to cause denial-of-service through management console application crashes.

item.title: CVE-2016-10258|2024-09-17T02:37:23.286Z -- symantec%20corporation -- advanced%20secure%20gateway%20%28asg%29
item.description: Unrestricted file upload vulnerability in the Symantec Advanced Secure Gateway (ASG) and ProxySG management consoles. A malicious appliance administrator can upload arbitrary malicious files to the management console and trick another administrator user into downloading and executing malicious code.

item.title: CVE-2018-5236|2024-09-17T00:46:52.311Z -- symantec%20corporation -- symantec%20endpoint%20protection
item.description: Symantec Endpoint Protection prior to 14 RU1 MP1 or 12.1 RU6 MP10 may be susceptible to a race condition (or race hazard). This type of issue occurs in software where the output is dependent on the sequence or timing of other uncontrollable events.

item.title: CVE-2016-10256|2024-09-17T00:06:18.696Z -- symantec%20corporation -- proxysg
item.description: The Symantec ProxySG 6.5 (prior to 6.5.10.6), 6.6, and 6.7 (prior to 6.7.2.1) management console is susceptible to a reflected XSS vulnerability. A remote attacker can use a crafted management console URL in a phishing attack to inject arbitrary JavaScript code into the management console web client application. This is a separate vulnerability from CVE-2016-10257.

item.title: CVE-2018-5242|2024-09-17T02:02:41.881Z -- symantec%20corporation -- norton%20app%20lock
item.description: Norton App Lock prior to version 1.3.0.329 can be susceptible to a bypass exploit. In this type of circumstance, the exploit can allow the user to circumvent the app to prevent it from locking the device, thereby allowing the individual to gain device access.

item.title: CVE-2018-18363|2024-09-17T01:45:56.053Z -- symantec%20corporation -- norton%20app%20lock
item.description: Norton App Lock prior to 1.4.0.445 can be susceptible to a bypass exploit. In this type of circumstance, the exploit can allow the user to circumvent the app to prevent it from locking the device, thereby allowing the individual to gain device access.

item.title: CVE-2016-10259|2024-09-17T01:45:40.309Z -- symantec%20corporation -- ssl%20visibility
item.description: Symantec SSL Visibility (SSLV) 3.8.4FC, 3.9, 3.10 before 3.10.4.1, and 3.11 before 3.11.3.1 is susceptible to a denial-of-service vulnerability that impacts the SSL servers for intercepted SSL connections. A malicious SSL client can, under certain circumstances, temporarily exhaust the TCP connection pool of an SSL server.

item.title: CVE-2016-9092|2024-09-17T03:02:49.547Z -- symantec%20corporation -- content%20analysis%20%28ca%29
item.description: The Symantec Content Analysis (CA) 1.3, 2.x prior to 2.2.1.1, and Mail Threat Defense (MTD) 1.1 management consoles are susceptible to a cross-site request forging (CSRF) vulnerability. A remote attacker can use phishing or other social engineering techniques to access the management console with the privileges of an authenticated administrator user.
